iirc i have the same (i have changed a hundred times the ndiswrapper(2version), default and the serialmonkey one driver
> can you help me how can i debug why? Knetworkmanager stops conencting, rutilt also.
I also had to disable NetworkManager and nm-applet completely, configuring it via System-Admin-Network instead.
'sudo chmod -x /etc/dbus-1/event.d/25NetworkManager /etc/dbus-1/event.d/26NetworkManagerDispatcher', and removing nm-applet from the Session startup.
the chmod -x procedure applies to kubuntu as well.
> thanx a lot, i need restart i think to networkmanager shuts up... brb!
no app. Just configure it via System-Administration-Network (disable roaming and set up DHCP)
> that is an application, or a way in gnome settings?
add these lines to your /etc/network/interfaces: "iface ra0 inet dhcp", "wireless-essid youressid" and "auto ra0"
replace ra0 with your real interface name and youressid with your ESSID ;)
when you're ready, do a 'sudo ifup ra0'
